titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William G. and J. S. Agnew papers, 1861-1864
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl December 2016

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.unittitle: William G. and J. S. Agnew papers
did.abstract: Letters of William and J.S. Agnew, probably brothers, serving in the Confederate forces. William's letters deal with the military affairs and camp conditions while he was involved with the Peninsular Campaign. J.S.'s letters, written from Chickamauga, Tenn., and Camp Foster, Ga., are concerned with personal and military matters.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: William G. and J. S. Agnew Papers, 1861-1864, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_section.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, December 2016.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Confederate soldier, from Alpine, Chattooga County, Ga.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letters of William and J.S. Agnew, probably brothers, serving in the Confederate forces. William's letters deal with the military affairs and camp conditions while he was involved with the Peninsular Campaign. J.S.'s letters, written from Chickamauga, Tenn., and Camp Foster, Ga., are concerned with personal and military matters.

did.unittitle: William G. and J. S. Agnew papers
